definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

sentences.english: But amid normal people these blandishments have no authority.
sentences.chinese: 不過這種甘言勸誘在普通人中影響力甚微。

sentences.english: The money, the ISSCR suggested, should not be enough to provide “undue inducement” for women to sell their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 這筆錢不應用於“過度勸誘”女性去賣自己的卵子。

sentences.english: It is propagandistic and manipulates the reader with purple prose.
sentences.chinese: 它用華麗的詞藻堆砌起來的散文勸誘和操縱讀者。

sentences.english: To induce by using strong personal attractiveness.
sentences.chinese: 用個人強烈的魅力哄誘，勸誘。

sentences.english: I think the essence of advertising is proselytizing.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲廣告的本質，就是勸誘。

sentences.english: Christianity, a strongly proselytizing religion, exists in all parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 基督教，極力勸誘宗教，存在於世界所有地區。

sentences.english: The salesman induced her to buy the vacuum cleaner which she didn't really need.
sentences.chinese: 推銷商勸誘她購買她並不需要的真空吸塵器。

sentences.english: The money, the ISSCR suggested, should not be enough to provide "undue inducement" for women to sell their eggs.
sentences.chinese: 這筆錢不應用於“過度勸誘”女性去賣自己的卵子。

sentences.english: It coaxes me to the vapor and the dusk.
sentences.chinese: 它勸誘我走向霧氣朦朧的黃昏。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
